findings.title: Redemption Fee Precision Check May Lead to Revert
findings.description: The function _getStrategyRedeemFeeBps would revert if redemptionFee values are below 1e14. This affects critical functions such as voluntaryExit.

findings.title: Unclear Access Control Policy May Lead to Griefing
findings.description: The access control policy may lead to griefing, but it was clarified by the Gelt team that the policy is as intended.

findings.title: minOutputQuantity During Redeems May Lead to Unfavorable Exchanges
findings.description: may cause arbitrarily unfavorable returned quantities of bAsset tokens.

findings.title: Privileged Roles and Ownership
findings.description: Public user-facing documentation should detail the actions that can be performed by privileged users.

findings.title: Missing Input Validation
findings.description: The initialize function accepts a number of important contract addresses that are permanently assigned to contract members. To avoid costly re-deployments where any of these parameters are accidentally set to address(0), input validation checks should be added.

findings.title: Unclear +1 Compensation in _calcStrategyRedeemAmount
findings.description: It is not clear if the +1 calculation is necessary in the following statement of _calcStrategyRedeemAmount. The +1 is necessary to compensate for rounding errors in the strategy since the return value of _calcStrategyRedeemAmount is used as an input to mAsset.redeem which internally uses computeRedeem that lacks the compensation for rounding errors.
